#n hlacʉna為啦阿魯哇的發音，即為Kanakanavu的racʉna

#c 在他的頂端有一個地方卡那卡那富稱其為Rangurunga。

#c 一個卡那卡那富男子帶著他的狗打獵。

#c 他們在那裡結束打獵之後，他們帶著那些狗回到Racʉnga.
#n 孔老師認為原是發音為pui’i

free: #e However, the dog mother bought her doggies back to Rancurunga herself.
#c 但是那隻生小孩的母狗獨自帶牠的小狗回到Rancurunga。

#c 據說那樣來來回回有三次
#n maka- 表次數
#n maka-cani 或是 maka-ucani 一次; maka-turu或是 maka’uturu

free: #e The Kankanavu elders thought why the dog kept bringing her doggies to Rancurung and back again.
#c 當時卡族的老人家就想著狗狗那樣來來回回究竟有什麼原因。

free: #e Therefore, elders at that time thought perhaps (those dogs) were telling them that they should move.
#c 因此，當時卡那卡那富老人家就想著或許狗狗是在告訴他們，他們該搬家了。
#n ’e是’esi的縮減
#n araavari 遷移、換位置; aravari-a請換;aravari-o去更換
#n mariivari回答; arivario kari Na’u 回答Na’u的話

#n papeni 幾位; papeni kamu cau cani pininga 你們家有幾個人?
#n upeni 幾個(東西); upeni=cu cenana=musu 你幾歲了? (cenana 年)

free: #e Afterwards, many Kanakanavu males moved Rancurunga with their dogs to live there.
#c 之後，就有不知道幾位卡族男士帶著狗搬到Rancurunga的地方定居。
#n c<um>a-cʉvʉrʉ 指長大，在此指「生活」。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e However, they thought without females, they could not have good lives there.
#c 但是又想沒有女人在那裡生活很不方便。

free: #e SO, they returned to nacʉnga to bring their women and children to Rancurunga to live and farm there.
#c 所以，他們回到nacʉnga要帶他們的女人和小孩到Racurunga那裏生活、墾地、種田。
#n 口誤racurunga應該要是nacʉnga

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Other Kanakanavu saw it looked good to move there.
#c 其他卡族人看到搬到那裡好像蠻好的。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They also did that.
#c 也都那樣。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They also moved to that place.
#c 也都搬去那裡。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They lived in Rangurunga.
#c 就在Rancurunga那個地方。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They farmed that place.
#c 那裡開墾田園。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They built houses.
#c 蓋房子。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They had lived there for a long time.
#c 他們在那邊待得很久。

free: #e These are what I’ve heard. I’ve heard that we Kanakanavu once lived in Nacʉnga and then moved to Rancurunga。
#c 這些我所聽到的，據說我們卡族曾經住在Nacʉnga之後搬到 Rancurunga那裡。

meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e However, when I grew up, at about forty years old, I heard some Kanakanavu said once Kanakanavu lived with Pingpu tribes at An-Ping, Tainan.
#c 但是當我長大之後，大約到了四十歲，有卡族人說以前卡族人曾經住在台南，現在叫做安平的地方，和平埔族一起生活。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They passed by Pingtong, going back and forth to the direction of Nanxi, Meinong, and Qishan.
#c 他們經過屏東，東那樣來來回回地走著往楠西、美濃、旗山的方向移動。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They went separate ways when they were in Meinong.
#c 當在美濃的時候，人們分道揚鑣。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is said that some people walked to Meinong, Liugue, and Tauyuen directly.
#c 據說有的人直走去美濃，去六龜，去桃源。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e There is a word saying that they are Ra’arua that we know now.
#c 就有這麼一說，他們就是現在的拉阿魯哇族。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is also said that some other people chose another way to go, passing Namasia to where we are living now.
#c 據說還有其他的人在旗山分道走了，經過那瑪夏，到達現在我們的地方。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Those people are we Kanakanavu.
#c 那些也就是我們卡那卡那富族人。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e What I’ve heard is like that.
#c 我所聽到的是那樣。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is said that we Kanakanavu had stayed there for a very long time.
#c 據說我們卡族人待在那裡很長的日子。
#n tarakanangà takanang-a 「所認識的」或者「太陽的位子」。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is also said there was overflowing water.
#c 據說有滿出來的水。
#n 之後就有洪水的傳說

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e And, an eel.
#c 據說有鰻魚。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is said that it stuck the water.
#c 據說他在水中堵住了水流。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e The water became much more.
#c 水變多了。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e All the fields and houses of Kanakanavu are washed away.
#c 卡族的耕地以及家都被沖走。
#n tumatʉpʉ 堵住

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Therefore, Kanakanavu escaped their homes to the top of mountains.
#c 所以卡族人逃到山頂去。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e At that time, there was no fire.
#c 據說那個時候沒有火。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e But, they saw another mountain in Tanʉ’ʉcʉ.
#c 據說看到在Tanʉ’ʉcʉ的山。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is said that there had fire.
#c 據說有火。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e It is said that, at that time, people and animals can understand and communicate with each other.
#c 在那個時候，據說人類和動物可以互相溝通，聽得懂話。
#n apakarikari為口誤，應是arupakarikari 互相通話

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e There was a muntjac.
#c 有一隻山羌。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e The muntjac said, ‘I will go to tana’ʉcʉ to get the fire.’
#c 山羌說：「我要去tana’ʉcʉ拿回火種。」
#n mara (拿) 和 umara (當下拿ing)

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e However, the fire was put out by water because the muntjac held the fire on its horns when it was swimming through the water.
#c 他把火種放在頭角上游泳過水，結果火種被水浸泡了，火種就滅掉了。
#n 該句有兩個口誤nimusʉpʉrʉ要改成nimusutavʉrʉ ‘被浸泡’，canumu 改成’apuru ‘火’。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e At last, there was a bird, Urune.
#c 最後，有隻鳥，被稱作urune
#n urune 是紅嘴黑鵯

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e it is said that the pecks of those birds were not red.
#c 那種鳥，據說以前他們的嘴巴不是紅色的。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e The bird said to human beings that he will go to the other side of the river to get the fire back’
#c 鳥對人說由他來去那個對岸拿火種。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e However, because it is too hot, his mouth became red.
#c 但是因為實在很熱，牠的鳥喙變成紅色。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Kanakanavu thought this Himalayan Black Bulbul was a really good bird.
#c Kanakanavu想著這個紅嘴黑鵯真正好啊！
#n cucur-ana!強調

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e So from then on, we have a song singing about that Himalayan.Black.Bulbul.
#c 所以從那時候起，我們有一首關於紅嘴黑鵯的歌。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Therefore, Kanakanavu resided there.
#c 那般之後，卡那卡那富族人就住在那瑪夏這裡。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Hoklo came first, Pingpu people came next, and then Japanese came. It is said that we kept moving our place.
#c 閩南人進來 平埔族也來了 日本人來了。據說我們所住的地方一直在移動著。
#n iavatu ‘來’，ivata ‘請來’，vata ‘來來來(呼喚)’ ，n-ivatu ‘來過了’，ivata-an ‘來看看’，’apivatu ‘使來’；[root: ivatu]。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Since then, we did not move to any other places.
#c 但是從那時候，我們就沒有再遷移到別的地方了。
#n 正確說法arivari 遷移

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Kanakanavu stay at Namasia.
#c 卡那卡那富族人就一直待在那瑪夏這個地方。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e However, in the past, there are some other people called us, as what Bunun called, Taivuran, when they were talking to us.
#c 但是，以前有其他人在跟我們卡族人談話時, 叫我們卡族Taivuran，布農族也那樣稱呼我們。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e But we do not like taivuran, this name.
#c 但是我們並不喜歡taivuran這個名字

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Since a long time ago, when we were talking to other people, we always called ourselves Kanakanavu.
#c 從以前開始，我們在告訴別人時，我們都自稱為卡那卡那富族。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Then, how long have we Kanakanavu lived here?
#c 那樣，我們卡那卡那富族待在那瑪夏這裡究竟有多久了？
#n 第一個ni-mon為false start

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Perhaps We have lived in Namasia and grew up there for four hundred or five hundred years.
#c 我們待在那瑪夏這裡生長大概有四百或五百年了。
#n nʉmʉ 口誤 應為mʉna
#n 應該要在數字詞後加入cenana 年

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e This is all I want to tell you. Thank you.
#c 我所要講的就是這樣。謝謝。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951
